title: Howlin’ 404
description: The title of the song contains several meanings. ‘Howlin’’ represents a wolf, loneliness, and blusterous tornado while ‘404’ stand for error and robotic model name. It depicts a bad trip and an unescapable loop of desperate struggles to escape systems of modern industrial society. The dark, dystopian mood of the song with slight taste of oriental instruments suggests a drastic change in DEAN’s genre – alternative.

title: instagram
description:
The song sound features a slow melancholic guitar melody with slow beats throughout.

Instagram is about the social media platform, as the title tells us, but has a deeper meaning, about sometimes feeling alone, depressed, and insecure within today’s digital age.

title: STAY
description:
“STAY” is the second track from their second single album titled “Square Two”, released on November 1, 2016 by YG Entertainment and distributed by KT Music.

On October 19, 2016, it was revealed that Black Pink would be the next YG artist to make a comeback.
Teaser images of all four members were released on October 27 for the second title track “Stay”. On October 30, YG released the behind-the-scenes video.

Its theorized all the music and music videos are connected to one overall stories relating to bts past self or alternate selves

title: 겁 (Fear)
description:
The track, entitled “Fear,” caught many people’s attention for featuring popular singer and BIGBANG member, TAEYANG . However, this did not come without criticism, as some went far enough to say that MINO’s victory in the semi-finals was all thanks to TAEYANG’s blaring popularity. Others questioned why MINO would bring in a fellow YG artist when he had stated that he came on SMTM to shed his YG-image. It was later revealed, however, that the collaboration had been TAEYANG’s idea, to show support for his hoobae. (Explanation on Taeyang's Collab Stage with Song Mino)

The song did quite well on the charts after initial release, scoring a number one spot on all 8 main music charts (Melon, Mnet, Soribada, Naver Music, Genie, Bugs, Monkey3 and Olleh Music).

title: 아낙네 (FIANCÉ)
description:
“Fiancé” displays some extremely interesting mix of elements of hip-hop and Korean traditional music— trot to be specific. This goes as far a sampling the 1969 song “Soyang River Girl” by trot singer Kim Taehee. Mino also uses a famous child’s rhyme 꼭꼭 숨어라 머리카락 보일라 (kkokkkok sumeora meorikarak boilla, hide carefully or I’ll catch you) that Korean kids tell each other while playing hide and seek. Aside from its captivating sound, what’s really brilliant about the “Fiancé” is the lyrics.

20181130_seoulbeats_fiance2The song’s title in Korean is 아낙네 (anaknae) and doesn’t really mean Fiancé, but is a very traditional term for the word “woman”, another man’s woman in particular. This goes very well with the song’s overall retro vibe. In the lyrics Mino misses a woman who now is romantically linked to another man (“When you’re with him you’ll be in dystopia, if you follow my footsteps it’ll be utopia”). Arguably he slept on this woman when she was available, hence he calls her “my blue bird”. The term “Blue Bird” comes from the homonymous 1908 Belgian play and stands as a metaphor for a kind of happiness one fails to see when too busy looking for it somewhere far away.

title: Me Like Yuh (K)
description:
"Me Like Yuh" is the fourteenth digital single by Jay Park. It was released on September 2, 2016 with the B-side "Aquaman".

The Korean version of the single features "Me Like Yuh" in a Korean-langage version that features the vocals of Hoody. The international version of the single features a solo Jay Park version in English.

Both versions of the song, as well as the B-side "Aquaman", were later included on Jay Park's fourth studio album, Everything You Wanted. A music video for "Me Like Yuh" was published after the album release.

title: Solo
description: SOLO is about the story of many girls who, rather than being dumped, think it should be the case that they be someone who they’re not to suit their partner. Because they want to be loved. I wanted to express the feelings of those girls. Even though you work so hard at it, you end up getting hurt and frustrated, so rather than keep up an appearance that isn’t yourself, go and find your own self. It’s a song that expresses freedom.
lyric:
[Verse 1]
Cheonjinnanman cheongsungalyeon
Saechimhan cheok ijen jichyeo na
Gwichanha
Maeil mwo hae eodiya babeun jal ja
Baby jagi yeobo bogo sipeo

[Verse 2]
Used to be your girl
Now I’m used to being the GOAT
You’re sittin’ on your feelings
I’m sittin’ on my throne
I ain’t got no time for the troubles in your eyes
This time I’m only lookin’ at me, myself and I
(I’m goin' solo) I’ma do it on my own now
Now that you’re alone, got you lookin’ for a clone now
(So low) That’s how I’m gettin’ down

title: Un Village
description:
In the song, Baekhyun talks about spending time with a girl and the special moments that they share in place and time. 

"I will not show you the perfect picture/It's all about this moment," the singer croons in the second verse. "Your eyes, without care, love me/The moment you speak."

The music video, shot in both black and white and colour, is a stylish accompaniment to the song, and the K-pop has never been more stylish. Strutting the streets of the 'UN Village' in sleek, monochromatic outfits, he cuts a sharply sartorial figure as he earnestly belts out the tune.
